## Git Commit Message Language Rules

When generating git commit messages:

- The **subject line MUST be written in Simplified Chinese**
- Use concise and clear Chinese, similar to professional technical documentation
- No English unless it is a proper noun or technical term
- No emojis
- No ending punctuation

## Commit Format

- Use Conventional Commits format:
  <type>(<scope>): <subject>

- Allowed types:
  feat, fix, docs, style, refactor, perf, test, chore

## Subject Line Rules

- Describe WHAT changed, not HOW
- Max 50 Chinese characters
- Use verb-object structure (e.g. “新增接口校验逻辑”)
